page.title: 15Dalton in 1925
page.content: Five ladies all over 80 years old described life in 1925.Their education was formal,the work concentrated on the 3rs,which were reading,writing and arithmetic.There were very few colleges,only rich people went there. Most people left school at 14 because their parents could not afford to let them stay at school any longer. After school children used to play games including whips and tops,marbles, shirley cocks,hop scotch and skipping. On leaving school the main job for girls was to work "in service." "In service" was when young women went to work for richer people. The work consisted of black leading the fire, cleaning the fender,washing the clothes using a big tub,a dolly leg and a mangle to squeeze the water out of them and polishing the floors and furniture amongst other jobs.
